GapFillInput.Title: Present tense after if, when, before and other time words
GapFillInput.Instruction: Put the verb in brackets ( ) into the correct tense.

Content.Question:
Karen: Thanks for a lovely weekend.
Tom: You're welcome.
Karen: You and Liz must come and stay with me
when you're|you are (you / be) in Scotland next.
Tom: We'd love to.
Karen: And I'll definitely e-mail (I / definitely / e-mail) you the photos
as soon as I get (I / get) home.
Tom: Great.
Grace: Hi Karen, it's me.
Karen: Oh hi Mum.
Grace: Are you doing|Are you going to do|Are you planning to do (you / do) anything tomorrow evening?
Karen: No, nothing special. Why?
Grace: Would you like (you / like) to come to a talk on garden design?
Karen: Oh … er … okay. What time is it?
Grace: 7.00 at the Sheldon Centre.
Karen: Okay. I'll come (I / come)
after I finish (I / finish) work.
Grace: Good. If you get (you / get) there first, keep me a seat.
Karen: Sure. See you then. Bye.
Grace: Bye.
